item.title: 600,000 Inquiries, No Waiting
item.description:
Purchasing important items can be a hassle, especially telecommunications services. It’s a maze of confusing calls, endless hold music, and tedious forms with long wait times. But imagine getting a price for a T1 line or finding nearby Metro Ethernet services in under a minute, any time, day or night. That’s where GeoQuote (tm) comes in. This innovative telecom pricing application is changing how businesses buy voice and data services...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/600-000-inquiries-no-waiting/

item.title: When Only T1 Will Do
item.description:
By: John Shepler While gigabit fiber connections are becoming the norm, T1 lines are still a relevant and useful option for bandwidth needs. T1 service remains popular and could be a perfect fit for your requirements, balancing speed and affordability. Why Consider T1 Lines? T1 is a well-established and widely available telecom service. Although Plain Old Telephone Service (POTS) was once the standard, it’s being replaced by VoIP and cloud-based systems in many businesses...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/-when-only-t1-will-do/

item.title: Try VoIP Phone Service For Under $10 a Month
item.description:
Ever considered trying out those new VoIP phone services to see if they’re better than your old landline? The ads are tempting, offering combined local and long-distance billing, tons of features without extra charges, and cheap international rates. It all sounds great and much cheaper than your current plan. Hesitations are understandable. Will you like the service? Will it work well with your internet? Maybe long-term contracts, especially at $40-$50 a month, aren’t appealing...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/try-voip-phone-service-for-under-10-a-month/

item.title: VoIP Land Lines Complement Wireless
item.description:
Traditional analog phone lines are commonly referred to as “landlines.” This term can also apply to digital services like T1 lines. Both analog and digital telephony have relied on buried copper wire pairs since the beginning of telephone service two centuries ago. The term “landline” distinguishes these copper wire-based telecom services from satellite and cellular wireless services. While landlines and wireless services may seem entirely distinct, they can be combined to offer significant advantages...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/voip-land-lines-complement-wireless/

item.title: Technologies That Should Stay in 2012
item.description:
While technological advancements are incremental, they often force us to upgrade to the latest devices while clinging to older ones for compatibility. Eventually, the old tech fades away, replaced by the new, only for the cycle to repeat itself. Let’s explore some technologies that are nearing obsolescence. Analog phone systems are on the verge of disappearing. Their outdated features, lack of mobile compatibility, and proprietary wiring make them impractical. While analog lines offer clear voice quality and affordability for small businesses, their lack of mobility is a dealbreaker...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/technologies-that-should-stay-in-2012/
